Text.Value: More actions may be associated to same gesture and priority defines which action and how is executed. - first active action with High priority is immediately executed - otherwise context menu of all actions is shown - single action with Normal priority is automatically executed - context menu is also shown when only one action with Low priority is active

Text.Value:
Auto Mode is used for automatic (de)activation of the Just Gestures (Application). It autocheks focused program and according to conditions sets the Application state. - Priority of condition corresponds to the order's number (fourth is the highest). - Final list contains the Application state when programs from Black/White List get focus. - Select automatic start of Autobehaviour in General options or start it manualy via tray icon's context menu.
Example: Auto disable the Application when Intert Explorer gets focus - set Default State to Auto Enable - set First Auto State to Black List (Black List has to contain Internet Explorer) - run Auto Mode via Application's system tray icon
Text.Comment: Options - Auto behave - info

Options - Autobehave - second auto state label

Options - Autobehave - default state label
Options - Autobehave - fullscreen state label

- Control Program/Window - all actions are associated with this option - Toggle Button - button which is used to carry out Curve gesture - Keep the Hold-down/Toggle Button pushed in Sensitive Zone for Deactivation Timeout and the Hold-down/Toggle Button will work normally.

Wizard - Activation - caption

Text.Value:
Almost all actions are associated to some window or program. Decide whether you want to apply actions to window under the cursor or in the foreground.
- In program is possible to make actions application sensitive (actions is active only if the application is). Therefore this option is also used to detect whether the application is active.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Activation - description of controling program/window which is under cursor/at foreground
Wizard - Activation - group box text for Gesture Activation

Text.Value: All values may be changed later in program via Options -> Gestures.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Activation - info

Text.Value:
Keep the Hold-down/Toggle button pushed in Sensitive Zone for Deactivation Timeout and the Hold-down/Toggle button will work normally.
Summary for type of gestures: - Curve Gesture - push the Toggle button and move mouse out of the Sensitive Zone within the Deactivation Timeout. - Double-button Combination - click on the Execute button while Hold-down button is pushed within the Deactivation Timeout and don't move mouse out of the Sensitive Zone. - Wheel-button Combination - move with the Wheel after while the Hold-down button is pushed within the Deactivation Timeout and don't move mouse out of the Sensitive Zone.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Activation - description of Sensitive Zone and Deactivation Timeout
Wizard - caption for Wizard form
Wizard - Classic Curve - caption

Text.Value:
- Push the Toggle button and move mouse out of the Sensitive Zone within the Deactivation Timeout to start recognition process of Curve gesture. Move with mouse according to specific curve to invoke associated action to this gesture.
- During recognition process stop mouse for a while and Tool tip with recognized gesture(s) will be shown.
- You may define your own curves of any kind of shape.
- All actions associated to Curve Gestures can be switched to Double-button combination gestures.
Note: If you keep the Toggle button pushed in Sensitive Zone for Deactivation Timeout the Toggle button will work normally.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Classic Curve - description

Text.Value: - Uncheck the gesture if you don't want to use it and the program will ignore this type of mouse gestures. - Sensitive Zone and Deactivation Timeout is possible to set at the end of Wizard.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Classic Curve - info

Text.Value: Hold down the Toggle button, move mouse in specific directions and release the Toggle button.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Classic Curve - Instructions for invoking the Classic Curve Gesture
Wizard - Double Button - caption

Text.Value:
- Click on the Execute button while Hold-down button is pushed within the Deactivation Timeout and don't move mouse out of the Sensitive Zone to invoke associated action to this gesture.
- The Double-button gesture is activated when Execute button is pushed, after that you can move out of Sensitive Zone.
- Keep the the Execute button pushed for a while and the Tool tip of recognized gestures will be shown.
- Do not release Hold-down button after the click on Execute button and you may activate another gesture (with same Hold-down button) by clicking on another Execute button.
- When the Hold-down and Execute buttons are pushed, release the Hold-down button first to deactivate the gesture. In this case the Execute button is switched to Hold-down button, therefore you are still in Double-button gesture mode and you may click on another Execute button.
- All actions (except the scripts containing the mouse events) associated to Double-button combination gesture may be switched to Curve gestures.
Note: If you keep the Hold-down button pushed in Sensitive Zone for Deactivation Timeout the Hold-down button will work normally.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Double Button - description

Text.Value: - Uncheck the gesture if you don't want to use it and the program will ignore this type of mouse gestures. - Sensitive Zone and Deactivation Timeout is possible to set at the end of Wizard.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Double Button - info

Text.Value: Click on the Execute button while Hold-down button is pushed.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Double Button - instructions for invoking Double Button Gesture
Wizard - Gestures - group box text for Activation
Wizard - Gestures - group box text for Description (used in all wizard forms)
Wizard - Gestures - group box text for Gesture
Wizard - Gestures - group box text for Preview
Wizard - Gestures - and label (used in group box activation for gestures)
Wizard - Gestures - Instructions label
Wizard - Classic Curve - Mouse Movement label
Wizard - Gestures - tool tip for Animating the gesture example
Wizard - name for Page (text that is part of counter located in right upper part of window)
Wizard - Welcome - caption

Text.Value: - This tool tip contains useful information about the actual page. - It explains some features, gives hints how to proceed, shows warnings and errors. - To display tool tip hover the mouse over the info icon. - Leave cursor from tool tip or click on it to hide it.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Welcome - info

Text.Value: You are about to use mouse enhancement utility - Just Gestures.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Welcome - caption for intro

Text.Value:
This wizard will help you configure and understand the most significant part about the gestures and some useful features. Please take a few minutes with these basic settings.
Note: - Move mouse over Info icon situated in the left bottom part of the window. It shows useful informations about the actual page.

Text.Comment: Wizard - Wheel Button - caption

Text.Value:
- Scroll with mouse wheel while the Hold-down button is pushed within the Deactivation Timeout and don't move mouse out of the Sensitive Zone to invoke appropriate action.
- The Wheel-button gesture is activated by first scroll with wheel, after that you can move out of Sensitive Zone.
- Activated Wheel-button gesture automatically executes action and doesn't show any Tool tip of recognized gestures..
Note: If you keep the Hold-down button pushed in Sensitive Zone for Deactivation Timeout the Hold-down button will work normally.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Wheel Button - description

Text.Value: - Uncheck the gesture if you don't want to use it and the program will ignore this type of mouse gestures. - Sensitive Zone and Deactivation Timeout is possible to set at the end of Wizard.
Text.Comment: Wizard - Wheel Button - info

Text.Value: Scroll with mouse wheel while the Hold-down button is pushed, then release Hold-down button.
